alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 13 at 12:27AM EDT until September 13 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN TALBOT...QUEEN ANNE`S...CENTRAL CAROLINE AND WESTERN KENT COUNTIES... At 1227 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Riverside to Old Town to near Easton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Centerville, Chestertown, Denton, Centreville, Oakland, Ridgely, Church Hill, Betterton, Queen Anne, Old Town, Starr, Jumptown, Newtown, Morgnec, Crumpton, Tanyard, Harmony, Skipton and Langford. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
